adjectives.description: surefooted (comparative more surefooted, superlative most surefooted)

entries.meaning: Walking steadily, without stumbling; capable of finding good footing.
examples: The mules of Piedmont are exceeding strong and hardy.  […]  They are the only carriage that can be used in crossing the mountains, being very sure-footed: and it is observed that in choosing their steps, they always march upon the brink of the precipice.
